item.title: A case for the mediocre developer
item.description: Software engineers today face a lot of difficulties in their jobs. The available toolset increases on a seemingly monthly basis. New frameworks are in, old frameworks are legacy. What was previously a job that could be specialized in across a few well-understood components is now spread out amongst large swaths of libraries, abstraction and infrastructure. This is the power of open-source, but also its curse. The fact that complexity is increasing around us is a trite argument. Due to this ongoing shift, itâ€™s easier than ever to start developing but harder than ever to become proficient in it. In light [â€¦]

item.title: Creating background .NET Core services on Linux
item.description:
There are a variety of ways to publish .NET Core applications. In the episode, Todd Gardner returns to share this experience with publishing self contained .NET applications to Linux.
[02:10] - What does the application architecture look like? [04:42] - Exploring the worker processes [10:50] - Collecting metrics [12:55] - Self contained deployments
.NET Core application publishing overview https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/deploying/?WT.mc_id=ondotnet-c9-cephilli
.NET Core logging and tracing https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/diagnostics/logging-tracing?WT.mc_id=ondotnet-c9-cephilli
.NET Core and systemd https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/net-core-and-systemd/?WT.mc_id=ondotnet-c9-cephilli
Request Metrics https://requestmetrics.com/
#dotnet #systemd #linux #deployment
item.author: (dotNET)

item.title: Blazor WebAssembly : Custom Authentication - EP11
item.description:
Hey Coders, Subscribe here - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCetyodKOWGk5H6FoKoFnkZw Talk to us on - https://www.twitch.tv/curiousdrive
Like our page - https://www.facebook.com/curiousdrive/ Follow us on - https://twitter.com/curious_drive Follow us on - https://www.instagram.com/curiousdrive/
Make a donation - https://www.paypal.me/curiousdrive Be a member - https://www.patreon.com/curiousdrive
GitHub - https://github.com/CuriousDrive/BlazingChat
In this episode of #Blazor WebAssembly, I am going through steps in integrate #Custom #Authentication for our app.
Authorization Package : https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Authorization
Topics that we are going to over - 1. Introduction & What we need to do. 2. Enable Authentication on Client and server-side 3. Writing #Login,#Logout & #GetAuthenticationState on the server-side 4. Custom Authentication State Provider 5. Testing and GitHub Repo
#CuriousDrive #WeLoveCoding
item.author: (Curious Drive)

item.title: Factorio - Trailer 2014
item.description:
The official Factorio trailer for 2014
You can watch the 2016 updated version of this trailer at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DR01YdFtWFI
You can try the demo at http://www.factorio.com.
Video: The Factorio team. Music & Sound: Daniel James Taylor (http://danieljamestaylor.co.uk/)
This trailer is based on a real game of about 12 hours. The map has been extended and polished in the in-game map editor. All the actions, movement and logic in general in the trailer are controlled by the game native modding system (lua scripting).
item.author: (Factorio)

item.title: Factorio - Trailer 2020
item.description:
The official Factorio trailer for 2020
Homepage (free demo / buy the game): http://www.factorio.com. Steampage: http://store.steampowered.com/app/427520/
Video: The Factorio team. Music & Sound: Daniel James Taylor (http://danieljamestaylor.co.uk/)
This trailer is based on a real game of about 12 hours. The map has been extended and polished in the in-game map editor. All the actions, movement and logic in general in the trailer are controlled by the game native modding system (Lua scripting).
This trailer is the second improved version of the original 2014 trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9yDZM0diiYc
item.author: (Factorio)
